title: Welcome to the Mauna Kea---Our 55+, Quiet, and Comfortable  Home!
posting_body: Mauna Kea Apartment Homes / 55+ / Adult / Age-Restricted / Seniors only
Handicapped Accessible / "Standard" 2 BR --the bathroom has been modified with a roll-in shower and ramp for wheelchair use.
11133 51st Avenue South
Seattle, WA 98178
show contact info
Neighborhood: Seward Park
Type of Unit: Standard Two Bedroom, 1 bathroom (Apartment)
Date Available:
Now
Rent: $1,075 per month
HELLO, AND WELCOME TO OUR COMFORTABLE QUIET, 55+ ADULT COMMUNITY!
Hi, I'm Terry Goodwin and I own the Mauna Kea Apartments---that's me in the picture in the lower right.
I'm proud of the Mauna Kea and I'm happy that you've stopped by to consider it.
And here's why:  the Mauna Kea is a great place for people who like a quiet, comfortable, and commotion-free home life, and want a well maintained home with a comfortable package of home-y amenities.
Are you at least 55 years old and looking for a well priced apartment home in a comfortable, quiet, and peaceful setting?
The Mauna Kea Apartments offers recently upgraded 1 and 2 bedroom apartments with unobstructed views west to the Olympic Mountains, north to downtown Seattle, and even a glimpse of Elliot Bay!
Selected units feature private balconies overlooking the pool and those same terrific views to the west.
Residents can take the elevator to enjoy our newly refurbished pool, or grill on the poolside patio.
The Mauna Kea is convenient, with freeway access only minutes away and a bus stop and Pea Patch just across the street.
The Mauna Kea is committed to providing comfortable, quiet, secure living in a competitively priced adult environment.
And yes, the Mauna Kea is a non-smoking / non-pet community.

At the risk of sounding like I'm crowing, the Mauna Kea has four strengths---a really great view, an especially large and attractive pool, a very, very quiet environment, and myself as a kind of cordial "small town Mayor".
I'm at the Mauna Kea very frequently, and everyone knows me, and I them.
I thought that I'd offer a bit more context about the Mauna Kea, and particularly my 'operating philosophy'.
I operate the Mauna Kea with an eye to creating quite long-term residencies for easy-to-get-along-with people.

A very integral part of that is that I don't maximize the possible rents---I don't try to squeeze every last $5 or $10 or $50/month that I might---I'd very much rather keep the Mauna Kea's rents at an acceptable level that Residents can live with, and create a situation where the same easy-to-get-along-with Residents can live there year after year, decade after decade, as they historically have.
That, I've found, is a 'winning hand' for everyone.
The Mauna Kea has choices to suit all housing preferences.
Let us show you what the Mauna Kea Apartments has to offer, and you'll see why our many long term residents stay here year after year.
One out of every seven residents has been with us over twenty years---come see why!
All Common Areas of the Mauna Kea are disinfected regularly with an CDC approved disinfectant, as are any apartments that I show to interested visitors.
So all of us can stay healthy and safe, please bring an approved mask and gloves if you wish to visit the Mauna Kea.
Though I've provided my phone # here and certainly will respond to it, I prefer an e-mail.
If you communicate via e-mail and think that the Mauna Kea might appeal to you, please send me a note so that I can arrange a showing for you.
If e-mail isn't for you, then of course please call me.
Thanks!
The Mauna Kea Apartments - Family Built, Family Owned, Family Operated.
Amenities:
Pool
Fitness Center
Near Bus Line
Elevator
High-Speed Internet Available
Balconies
Dishwasher
Wonderful mountain and distant city views
One complementary Parking Space/apartment
Complementary Storage Locker
Underground secure parking, if available
Modern Kitchen
Heated and furnished Laundry Rooms on every floor.
Attractive and comfortable Lobbies
'Secure' building  scheduled--Summer, 2021
And most importantly: great neighbors throughout the building!
Please e-mail me for more information or to arrange a showing.
When you do so, please include your first and last name.
Please write me using my first name--terry--followed immediately by the first letter of my last name--g--and then the remainder:  <URL>.
Please include your own address in any e-mail to me.
In the interest of mutual security I don't reply to anonymous or unverifiable addresses.
Thank you,
Terry Goodwin
